definition: to have an audience (with the Emperor)
(history) to have an audience with the Emperor
to appear/also written 現|现[xian4]
to see/to meet/to appear (to be sth)/to interview

sentences.english: Shojo: Miko Miyazaki, the orders I gave you were to deliver this halfling to my audience chamber.
sentences.chinese: 我给你的命令是把这名半身人送到觐见室。

sentences.english: You must obey the king's summons .
On the Chrysanthemum Terrace tomorrow morning.
sentences.chinese: 明晨在菊花台等候觐见。

sentences.english: They go from strength to strength; every one of them comes before God in Zion.
sentences.chinese: 他们的体力越行越有，到熙雍觐见至高天主。

sentences.english: You must obey the king's summons.
At the time the ship's company were worried about her squawking expletives when meeting the Royal couple.
sentences.chinese: 当时舰员们担心她在觐见女王夫妇时会发出咒骂。

sentences.english: We hope to see Her Majesty.
sentences.chinese: 我们希望觐见女王陛下。

sentences.english: Sentinel , I would speak with your High Priestess.
sentences.chinese: 守卫，我请求觐见高等月神牧师。

definition: to have an audience with
call in (one's subordinates)/summon (an envoy of a foreign country) to an interview
to have an audience (with the emperor)
to have an audience (with the Emperor)
to pay a formal visit/to call to pay respects/to meet one's senior or superior
to confer a title upon sb/to dub/to crown/to invest with rank or title
to enter the emperor's palace/(slang) to go to jail
issue a decree
(diplomatic) envoy
special envoy/special ambassador
to go abroad as ambassador/to be sent on a diplomatic mission
regent
diplomatic mission
to receive sb/to grant an interview
Your Majesty/His or Her Majesty
imperial edict/see also 上諭|上谕[shang4 yu4]
